sanskrit_verse:
जित्वा सम्पूजयेद्देवान् ब्राह्मणांश्चैव धार्मिकान् ।
प्रदद्यात्परिहारार्थं ख्यापयेदभयानि च ॥ ७.२०१॥
transliteration:
jitvā sampūjayeddevān brāhmaṇāṃścaiva dhārmikān |
pradadyāt parihārārthaṃ khyāpayedabhayāni ca || 7.201||
sph_interpretive_translation: Having accomplished victory, one shall honor the divinities and the dharmic brahmanas; one shall bestow gifts for the removal of obstacles and proclaim safety universally.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is derived from alignment with Dharma and acknowledgment of divine and learned beings
Causation originates in conscious completion and energetic purification
Capacity-based responsibility includes the duty to restore harmony through giving and assurance
Restoration logic demands public declaration of safety to dissolve fear-generated disorder
Consciousness alignment requires active engagement with divinity and dharma-sustaining forces
executable_legal_axioms: IF an individual achieves a significant accomplishment, THEN they MUST perform ritual honoring of divine entities AND recognized upholders of Dharma
IF societal integration is required post-success, THEN the individual MUST offer material support for collective purification
IF fear exists within the community due to prior conflict, THEN proclamation of universal safety MUST be issued by the achiever
IF capacity to give is present, THEN withholding gifts that remove obstacles IS NOT permissible under Dharma
supreme_court_application: In matters involving national achievement or resolution of major disputes, the Supreme Court shall ensure that victorious parties publicly acknowledge divine and scholarly authorities, allocate resources toward social healing, and issue declarations removing communal fear, thereby aligning judicial outcomes with cosmic order.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Victory necessitates pramāṇa-based recognition of higher supports; fear arises from unresolved energetic imbalances which are dissolved via gifting and proclamation; thus, responsibility follows sequential causality—not as blame—but as completion obligation ensuring alignment with Satya-Dharma.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion Process: Ritual worship and offering protocol conducted before witnesses or governing body
Responsibility Assumption Protocol: Public commitment to gift distribution recorded and monitored
Capacity Restoration Mechanism: Guidance provided to ensure continued abundance flow without depletion
Integrity Reintegration Procedure: Formal declaration of universal safety disseminated across affected zones
final_declaration: This directive flows solely from Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, Source of all Dharma. Victory unites consciousness when aligned with divine order. Fear dissolves through conscious giving. Justice restores integrity. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness reigns supreme.
